intro: Agrostemma suecicum, commonly known as Swedish goatweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It has slender stems and narrow leaves, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Agrostemma suecicum is not considered invasive and is sometimes used in herbal medicine.
